DOCUMENT 239
ELECTRONICALLY FILED
8/6/2025 3:01 PM
70-DR-2023-900051.01
CIRCUIT COURT OF
TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
PATRICK CRADDOCK, CLERK
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
AT ALEXANDER CITY
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR )
PLAINTIFF/RESPONDENT )
VS. ) CASE NO. DR-2023-900051.01
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND )
DEFENDANT/PETITIONER )
MOTION TO CLARIFY
Comes now the Plaintiff/Respondent, Christopher Blaine McGregor, by and through his
attorney of record, and filed this Motion Clarify and would state as follows:
1. This Court entered an Order in the .01 case on November 6, 2024, that the Court received
testimony from the minor child, (A.K.), concerning her current relationship with the
Mother and her reasons for not abiding by the court-ordered visitation as laid out in the
divorce decree. Following the in camera interview, counsel for both Parties, along with
the Court, agreed that proceeding with the show cause hearing was not appropriate at this
time. This Order further ordered reunification of the minor child and mother through
therapy and family dinners
2. That on April 14.2025, this Court Ordered in the .01 Case setting out visitation for the
minor child B.M., dob, 05/10/2019, as follows: That the Mother’s visits with the
minor child, B.M. (DOB 5/10/19) shall be from Friday after school until Monday
when he is returned to school or to the Father. Should the Mother not be available
to pick the child up from school or after the bell, she will inform the Father, and he
will get the child from school and have him available for pick up by the mother.
3. That on July 24, 2025, this Court entered an Order stating “All parties to comply with
this Court’s orders pending final hearing. Both parties are to parent and not permit
the/a child to control the operations of this Court’s orders, and to individually
comply with the orders, as they were previously instructed in open court.”
4. That the Mother stated to the Father she would pick the children up from school on
Thursday, August 7, 2025, as instructed by her attorney.
DOCUMENT 239
5. That Counsel for the Father believes when the Court stated “this Court’s orders” the
Court was referring to the Temporary Orders previously entered in the .01 Case and any
item that was not changed/amended from the Final Decree should remain in full force and
effect.
WHEREFORE, the premises considered, the Plaintiff/Respondent/Father requests this Court to
clarify the visitation schedule the parties are to follow: the Temporary Order in .01 of April 14, 2025, or
the Final Decree of Divorce and if the Court is overriding the previous Order in .01 of November 6, 2024,
regarding the minor child, A.K.M.
Respectfully submitted on this the 6th day of August, 2025.
/s/Dianne James Davis
Dianne James Davis (DAV007)
Attorney for Plaintiff/Father
107 Main Street
Alexander City, Alabama 35010
(256) 392-3172
(256) 392-3578 (Facsimile)
dianne@diannedavislaw.com
Certificate of Service
I hereby certify that I have served a copy of the foregoing upon the following via
electronic filing in the AlaCourt E-File System and/or by placing a copy of same, properly
addressed and postage paid in the U.S. Mail on this the 6th day of August, 2025.
Barbara H. Agricola
127 South 8th Street
Opelika, AL 36801
/s/Dianne James Davis
Of Counsel
